intro: Paramollugo decandra, commonly known as the African marshmallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fleshy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in wetland habitats and is often found in swampy areas or along riverbanks. Its mucilaginous seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a natural thickening agent.
